newsitem.title: UK: BSkyB tumbles on C&W merger news.
newsitem.headline: BSkyB tumbles on C&W merger news.

text.p: Shares in BSkyB, up some 70 percent so far this year, suffered a setback on Tuesday after Cable & Wireless said it would merge its UK operations with those of Nynex CableComms Group and Bell Cablemedia.
At 0826 GMT, BSKyB shares were down 15p to 681-1/2p on trading volume of 1.3 million. They were among the most heavily traded stocks in London.
Shares in C&W, meanwhile, surged 23-1/2p to 464-1/2p on volume of 9.2 million, placing them at the top of London's most active list.

C&W's link with Nynex CableComms and Bell Cablemedia "means there will be a more powerful company with which to negotiate," said Henderson Crosthwaite analyst Louise Barton. "BSkyB won't be able to walk all over others in the same way."
She said BSkyB shares, which rose to a record peak at 698p yesterday, were due for a correction.
"The C&W news is a slight negative for BSkyB, but the price has been roaring ahead and the market has been looking for any excuse to knock it down," Barton said.
